discussion.title: How to use cond operator?
discussion.body:
Hi,

I try to use 'cond' operator, but I keep receiving the error:
"The operator `cond` returned an output of type `Int64`, when it was given inputs -100.0 and -100.0 of type `Float32`. Please ensure that your operators return the same type as their inputs".

I'm using the following configuration in PySRRegressor:

```
model_pysr = PySRRegressor(
    niterations=50, 
    batching=True,
    batch_size=1000,
    binary_operators=["+", "*", "-", "/", 'cond'],
    unary_operators=['square', 'cube', 'exp', 'sqrt', 'log10', 'tan'],
    model_selection = 'accuracy', 
    elementwise_loss='L2DistLoss()',
    parsimony = 0.1
)
```
I've also tried to add 'cond' as a custom operator, but with the same outcome. 
Any help resolving this problem is appreciated.

nodes.body:
It could be an issue of your custom operator overwriting the internal one. Try restarting.

Itâ€™s defined here: https://github.com/MilesCranmer/SymbolicRegression.jl/blob/b0cf4efda8deef80976b757b233a3c64e5d5b592/src/Operators.jl#L113
